page.title: 03HALL FARM, KNETTISHALL
page.content: The Bucher's farm is called Hall Farm. There are 500 pedigree friesian cows. The cows are milked twice daily starting at 5.00am and 2.30pm. There are 32 milking bays in the parlour. Each cow enters a bay where there is a supply of grass and corn. The men attach the machines to the cow's udder. Then the cows are milked for about 7 minutes. When this is ended, the machine stops automatically. The Milk Marketing Board collects the milk to be pastuerised. The EEC rules have not affected his production. The farm has 1000 acres which are used to grow sugar beet, barley, wheat and grass. Mr. Bucher rotates his crops all the time as the soil is sandy and they are easily affected by the weather. There are 12 people on the farm who farm with machinery.
